clinical_study.brief_title: Occupational Therapy's Role in Promoting Community Wellness Utilizing Sit-Stand Workstations
clinical_study.official_title: Occupational Therapy's Role in Promoting Community Wellness: A Multi-modal Approach to Combat Sedentary Behavior in the Workplace Utilizing Sit-Stand Workstations

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to combat the growing global health issue of sedentary behavior and the associated health consequences of prolonged sitting in the workplace. The population of desk-based workers makes up a relatively large population and are an important target for this health promoting initiative with a focus on improving posture, encouraging movement, and fostering a more active and healthy business community. It's important to recognize that occupational therapy practitioners can contribute to community health promotion/disease prevention programs by the skill-set of practitioners to understand habits and routines that influence the adoption and maintenance of healthy behaviors.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in baseline movement at work at 6 months
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3 months, and 6 months (end of study)
primary_outcome.description: Movement at Work Questionnaire, Behavioral Report

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in baseline willingness to modify behavior to use the sit to stand workstation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3 months, and 6 months (end of study)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in baseline musculoskeletal discomfort at work at 6 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Beginning of study, 3 months, and 6 months (end of study)
secondary_outcome.description: Cornell Musculoskeletal Discomfort Questionnaire, Behavioral Report

arm_group.description: This group will be required to alternate periods of sitting and standing every 30 minutes throughout their workday using the sit to stand workstation.
This group will be required to alternate periods of sitting and standing every 60 minutes throughout their workday using the sit to stand workstation.
This group will be required to alternate periods of sitting and standing every 90 minutes throughout their workday using the sit to stand workstation.

intervention.description: A sit to stand work station.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants must spend > 50% of their work day seated at the computer
- Participants must be primarily English speaking
- Participants must work within the Health Sciences Center building at West Virginia University
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants who are less than 18 years of age
- Participants who are not primarily English speaking
- Participants who spend <50% of their work day seated at the computer
- Participants who do not work within the Health Sciences Center building at West Virginia University
- Participants who are pregnant
